intro: Elaeosticta lutea, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with woody stems and hairy foliage. Elaeosticta lutea is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert landscapes.
